t: Isaiah 65
The Righteousness of God’s Judgment
“I*pn was sought by those*i who*i did not ask for*i Me;*i I*ld was found by those*i who*i did not seek Me. I*ld said, ‘Here I am, here I am,’ To*ld a nation that*i was not called by My name.
I*ld have stretched out My hands all day long to a rebellious people, Who*ld walk in a way that*i is*i not good, According*ld to their own thoughts;
A*ld people who provoke Me to anger continually to My face; Who*ld sacrifice in gardens, And*ld burn incense on altars of brick;
Who*ld sit among the graves, And*ld spend the night in the tombs; Who*ld eat swine’s flesh, And*ld the broth of abominable things is in*i their vessels;
Who*ld say, ‘Keep to yourself, Do*ld not come near me, For*ld I am holier than you!’ These*ld are*i smoke in My nostrils, A*ld fire that burns all the day.
“Behold,*ln it*i is*i written before Me: I*ld will not keep silence, but will repay— Even*ld repay into their bosom—

Your*ld iniquities and the iniquities of your fathers together,” Says*ld the Lord,*s “Who*ld have burned incense on the mountains And*ld blasphemed Me on the hills; Therefore*ld I will measure their former work into their bosom.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “As*pn the new wine is found in the cluster, And*ld one*i says, ‘Do not destroy it, For*ld a blessing is*i in it,’ So*ld will I do for My servants’ sake, That*ld I may not destroy them all.
I*ld will bring forth descendants from Jacob, And*ld from Judah an heir of My mountains; My*ld elect shall inherit it, And*ld My servants shall dwell there.
Sharon*ld shall be a fold of flocks, And*ld the Valley of Achor a place for herds to lie down, For*ld My people who have sought Me.
“But*ln you are*i those who forsake the Lord,*s Who*ld forget My holy mountain, Who*ld prepare a table for Gad, And*ld who furnish a drink offering for Meni.

Therefore*ld I will number you for the sword, And*ld you shall all bow down to the slaughter; Because,*ld when I called, you did not answer; When*ld I spoke, you did not hear, But*ld did evil before My eyes, And*ld chose that*i in which I do not delight.”

Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*pn My servants shall eat, But*ld you shall be hungry; Behold,*ld My servants shall drink, But*ld you shall be thirsty; Behold,*ld My servants shall rejoice, But*ld you shall be ashamed;
Behold,*ld My servants shall sing for joy of heart, But*ld you shall cry for sorrow of heart, And*ld wail for grief of spirit.
You*ld shall leave your name as a curse to My chosen; For*ld the Lord God*s will slay you, And*ld call His servants by another name;

So*ld that he who blesses himself in the earth Shall*ld bless himself in the God of truth; And*ld he who swears in the earth Shall*ld swear by the God of truth; Because*ld the former troubles are forgotten, And*ld because they are hidden from My eyes.
The Glorious New Creation
“For*pn behold, I create new heavens and a new earth; And*ld the former shall not be remembered or come to mind.
But*ld be glad and rejoice forever in what I create; For*ld behold, I create Jerusalem as*i a rejoicing, And*ld her people a joy.
I*ld will rejoice in Jerusalem, And*ld joy in My people; The*ld voice of weeping shall no longer be heard in her, Nor*ld the voice of crying.

“No*ln more shall an infant from there live*i but*i a*i few*i days, Nor*ld an old man who has not fulfilled his days; For*ld the child shall die one hundred years old, But*ld the sinner being*i one hundred years old shall be accursed.
They*ld shall build houses and inhabit them;*i They*ld shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

They*ld shall not build and another inhabit; They*ld shall not plant and another eat; For*ld as the days of a tree, so*i shall*i be*i the days of My people, And*ld My elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
They*ld shall not labor in vain, Nor*ld bring forth children for trouble; For*ld they shall*i be*i the descendants of the blessed of the Lord,*s And*ld their offspring with them.
“It*ln shall come to pass That*ld before they call, I will answer; And*ld while they are still speaking, I will hear.

The*ld wolf and the lamb shall feed together, The*ld lion shall eat straw like the ox, And*ld dust shall*i be*i the serpent’s food. They*ld shall not hurt nor destroy in all My holy mountain,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
